intro: Cyrtandra bruteliana, commonly known as the Hawaiian bluebell, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and stream banks. Cyrtandra bruteliana has small, elliptical leaves and produces showy, tubular flowers that attract pollinators like bees and hummingbirds. It is considered a rare and endangered species due to habitat loss and invasive species.
